Module 2 Accessing ForestPlots

Module 2 Accessing ForestPlots When re-censusing a plot, you need access to the data from the previous censuses in order to make a field sheet to collect the data and to find the plot. All of this data is stored on ForestPlots.net. In order to access the data, you must Read the code of conduct, Register to have an account on ForestPlots here, and Email the associated country data officer to ensure the account is granted and to receive the necessary training to use ForestPlots. Note: Nika Gorski is the data officer for Africa data. Only once you have completed these steps will you be able to access data to ForestPlots and produce field sheets. If you haven’t fully completed these steps, you can still move on to Module 3 and 4 to install the necessary software on your laptop and tablet.

Module 5 Data Collection via Excel Learning Objectives Understand how to collect ForestPlots data using Excel on a tablet Set up your computer In order to collect data on your tablet via excel, you need two things: To stay organised and Excel Hopefully, you have already configured this in Module 2 and 3. If you have not set up your devices, return to the section Setting up your devices. If you already have Excel on your tablet and laptop, then you are ready to prepare your field sheets. Preparing field sheets on ForestPlots If you already know how to prepare field sheets through the ForestPlots database, skip ahead to the next section. If you need a refresher on how to create field sheets, watch this video or visit page 174 of the ForestPlots Manual. If you’ve never been shown how to make field sheets before by a ForestPlots team member, reach out to the data officer of the country that you will be collecting data in and request training (see Module 2). Preparing field sheets for the tablet Preparing field sheets to collect data on a tablet is very similar to preparing regular field sheets. In fact, the first step is the same: - download a field sheet from ForestPlots, - and format the field sheet to only see the columns that you want to work with. The next step is slightly different. Rather than set your print area, now you are going to lock columns that you do not want to accidentally modify in the field.
